items.title: 'Gone off like a rocket': Households cash in on battery rebate
items.description: Battery uptake is booming since the federal government rebate came into effect in July. Here's what you need to know if you are thinking of joining the thousands of Australians adding a battery to their home solar systems.

items.title: Josh Burns to take rare extended parental leave from parliament next year
items.description: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

items.title: Trump says there will be 'hell to pay' if Hamas fails to disarm
items.description: The US president has been hosting Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his residence in Florida for talks on Gaza and several other issues.

items.title: Zelenskyy denies attacking Putin's Novgorod home with long-range drones
items.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov says Moscow will review its position on a planned peace deal with Ukraine due to the alleged attack.

items.title: After 20 years missing in action, ASIC has found its teeth
items.description: After 20 years in the wilderness, the Australian Securities and Investments Commission's rehabilitation as a law enforcement agency seems almost complete.

items.title: Your soft plastic bags can once again be recycled. Here's how
items.description: Australia's first large-scale soft plastics recycling facility is processing huge loads each day, turning waste into a useful raw material.

items.title: Trump says US 'knocked out' a 'big facility' in Venezuela
items.description: A US strike on Venezuelan soil would be the first known land attack in the country since the Trump administration began ratcheting up pressure on its ruling regime, which Donald Trump accuses of "narco-terrorism".

items.title: Big bank convinced communications watchdog to delay revealing damaging news
items.description: The Commonwealth Bank persuaded a key regulator to delay announcing it had broken spam laws until after its AGM, new documents reveal.

items.title: Bystanders fight off alleged Melbourne carjacker
items.description: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

items.title: Jessica could have a cochlear implant but decided not to. Here's why
items.description: Cochlear implants can be a life-changing tool for people with hearing loss, but some Deaf people argue their use risks compromising their community's identity.

items.title: Looking back at the news that captured your attention in 2025
items.description: It was a year that bought us a federal election, ongoing war in the Middle East and Ukraine and a trial in a small Victorian town watched keenly around the world.

items.title: Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree are full of scammers. Here is how to avoid them
items.description: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that did not stop her from being scammed. Here is what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.

items.title: What happened when we tested a new therapy chatbot
items.description: Is it possible to make a "safe" AI therapy bot? We tested the limits of a new Australian-designed chatbot that's been carefully designed not to hallucinate or be your best friend.

items.title: 'Incredibly lucky' bushwalker survives bite from giant brown snake
items.description: A woman hiking on the NSW south coast has survived being bitten twice by an eastern brown snake more than 2 metres long.

items.title: A shock diagnosis meant Annette and her husband had to plan for his death
items.description: Dying in sudden, unexpected circumstances is not something people often consider, but there are plenty of reasons to create an end-of-life plan. So why do so few people have one?

items.title: Cyclone Hayley strengthens as it closes in on Kimberley coast
items.description: Tropical Cyclone Hayley is upgraded to a category four system as it nears the northern WA coast.

items.title: How history nearly repeated for a Beatle at the hands of a troubled fan
items.description: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, Harrison survived the attack by a knife-wielding attacker, though Harrison's friends and family speculated it ultimately hastened his death less than two years later.

items.title: Australian researchers 'ringing alarm' on globally threatened rhino rays
items.description: Australian researchers are leading the way in the fight to protect a group of globally threatened fish species, which look like "a shark and ray joined together".

items.title: Overall Sydney to Hobart leader switches as boats race ahead of wind change
items.description: Defending champion Celestial V70 is no longer in contention for a back-to-back overall victory in the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race, as more boats arrive in Hobart.

items.title: 'I didn't even know they gambled': An 'invisible' factor in suicide
items.description: A researcher says data on gambling-related suicides underestimates the crisis "devastating people and families".

items.title: Sportsbet fined $313k for 'systemic failure' to thousands of customers
items.description: Australia’s largest online bookmaker has been fined $313,000 for breaching its licence conditions, in what one gambling researcher described as a "slap on the wrist".

items.title: Outback city rumbles through a record year of ground shaking
items.description: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

items.title: How Australian cities will ring in the New Year
items.description: There are plenty of free events around the country to see out 2025 and welcome 2026. See what's happening in your city.

items.title: Van parks vacant and tackle shops struggling as WA fishing ban bites
items.description: An empty caravan park during what is usually peak season for a popular WA fishing town reveals the impact new restrictions are having on the Midwest coast.

items.title: Inside south-east Queensland's largest water reservoir Wivenhoe Dam
items.description: South-east Queensland's largest water reservoir provides drinking water and protection from flooding. So, how does it all work?
